positiveText: Breakfast items and all staff were phenomenal an extremely helpful. And location to Shinigawa station was very ideal.
negativeText: Air conditioning in public spaces to be stronger. Addional charge for extra bed when room was paid for three persons already.

positiveText: It was right next to Shinagawa station which was convenient for us to get to the airport on our last day. Everything was good and room was comfortable and spacious throughout. Room service was immaculate. We were given the option to upgrade at a cost but we didn't take it as we're only staying for one night.
negativeText: It was on the expensive end of hotel rooms. It would be amazing if they have actually given us the upgrade for free.
title: Good, but could have been better for this price tag.

positiveText: Excellent service, multilingual staff, wonderful!
negativeText: I wish I had more time there!

positiveText: We really were impressed by Strings. Service was excellent. We celebrated our 60th anniversary there, Bruce (manager) introduced himself and made us feel very welcome and we received special gifts which was a lovely touch.
negativeText: Nothing
title: Very successful

positiveText: Out of 10 being the highest  - The location 10 (3 mintes walk, if that, to Shinagawa Station,  a major hub in Tokyo). Breakfast 10 (partly because of the out of the oven, fantastic croissants & fresh made smoothies delivered to the table, daily; Japanese,  Chinese, and Continental elements; made to order station with great chefs). Wide open, high ceiling lounge for breakfast 10. Very quiet room 10. Good view 10. Laundry service 10. Ease of checking out 10.
negativeText: Reception area was too small. Lack of hours @ its Chinese Restaurant, which produces wonderful dishes (dinner was not available).
title: Switching from Westin Tokyo

positiveText: Breakfast buffet was exceptional.  Fresh bakery goods, solid Japanese options,  fun quality Chinese dishes,  good options of juices... and the floor servers were very attentive.  And laundry was super well done.  Even an old stain on a shirt was removed.
negativeText:
I'd like to have 2 sets of towels per person.  For 2 of us,  there were 3... The room was not dirty but something was missing from super clean "feeling." Also,  you should have recycle bin. And the quality of greentea bags was poor... we are in JAPAN!  And the worst,  not enough hooks in the bathroom! We needed a hook or two per person. And we didn't like the day bed sofa. Pls give us 2 chairs for the table,  instead. 
Overall, this stay was very much on the par with Tokyo Westin, but for the price and location, I'd be staying here in the future.
title: My first stay at IC Yokyo was super

positiveText: Easy access from the train station. Great breakfast. Nice clean rooms. Excellent service.
Location. Easy access to train station.
negativeText: None
title: It was a pleasant experience

positiveText: Breakfast was great. Rooms were large for Tokyo, very comfortable, great bathrooms.

Location was very convenient for departures/arrivals at Haneda Airport. Very easy access. 
Rooms very clean and attention was excellent.
The stay was pleasant, with friendly staff and good conditions. The only downside was the breakfast, which was rather limited in variety for a hotel of this level.
title: Great hotel .

positiveText: Location
negativeText: Staff are not friendly
title: Convenience and close to station

positiveText:
loved the amenities 
staff were wonderful and made the stay 
 memorable
title: exceptional hotel

positiveText: Very comfortable, quiet and clean
negativeText: Location was perfect
title: Relaxing save the stuff for amazing. Everything was really perfect.

positiveText: Loved the hotel and the club lounge experience! The hotel is in a fantastic spot - Shinagawa station connects to everything. Also great restaurants nearby both small noodle bars and bigger restaurants. The station also has an isetan (supermarket) and corner stores (7 eleven, newsday etc)
negativeText: Nothing!
title: Absolutely loved it!

positiveText: Very convenient location at a Shinkansen station and close to Haneda. Great hotel with great views, on good days you can see Mount Fuji.
title: Tokyo stay

positiveText: Such a luxurious hotel right next to Shinagawa station. The staff were incredibly kind and always willing to help with anything you may need. Being basically in Shinagawa station was so helpful coming from Narita airport and was well connected to the rest of Tokyo. The bathtub was spacious and luxurious and the bed was extremely comfortable. This was probably my favorite hotel we stayed in in Japan and we will definitely be staying again next time we come to Tokyo.
negativeText: Honestly there isn't much to complain about! I'd say the only thing I think they could improve on is if they had a few more in room amenities like other hotels in Japan. But that's such a nitpick cause this was truly an incredible hotel.
title: A spacious, comfortable hotel with a gorgeous view just steps away from Shinagawa station

positiveText:
The breakfast is lavish - so many options. Worth the price.  
Got a late check out which was nice but you need to be a IHG member for that and for free internet. Get a membership number.   It had a small but useful gym. The location near Shinagawa station was great - for direct train to Haneda and to the bullet train to Osaka and Hiroshima.
negativeText: The room was small a basic double room. Big bed, however, it felt like it was king size. Nice closet but not many drawers for clothes.   I would try to get a room that did not face the tracks.  I think I would have had to pay more for a different view.
title: Great location, charming classy hotel

positiveText: I recently stayed at The Strings Continental Japan Tokyo, and I had a wonderful experience. The room was beautiful with stunning views, and everything was exceptionally clean. The customer service was top-notch, with friendly staff providing 10/10 service every single day. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming throughout the hotel. I opted for the breakfast buffet, and I’m glad I did – the food was delicious and made for a great start to each day. The only downside was the need to rely on the train system daily, as taxis are expensive, but it’s manageable if you’re prepared. Overall, I had a 10/10 stay and would highly recommend it!
title: I recently stayed at The Strings Continental Japan Tokyo, and I had a wonderful experience. The room was beautiful with

positiveText:
We had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental Strings Hotel in Tokyo this past July. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with incredible warmth and professionalism. The hospitality we received each morning at breakfast was a highlight of our stay—it felt so personal and thoughtful, making our mornings extra special.

The rooms were spacious, beautifully maintained, and offered all the comfort we needed for a family stay. We truly appreciated the hotel’s convenient location near Shinagawa Station, which made getting around Tokyo easy and stress-free.

Overall, the hotel provided an excellent balance of luxury, comfort, and hospitality, and we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable stay in Tokyo.
The location is just steps to the metro and rail station. The rooms are very cozy and spacious. The breakfast is amazing and delicious.

Location to shinagawa train station was great. Easy to get to anywhere in Tokyo. Breakfast was also good. Restaurant staff were extremely nice and helpful. Rooms were clean, spacious and the fitness room was good enough
negativeText: I would have wanted more help from the concierge when we wanted to make reservations or have recommendations. It didn't feel like above and beyond jn my opinion. This didn't detract from our vacation however.

positiveText: Inside the station
negativeText: None
title: Wonderful will come again

positiveText: The breakfast, friendly staff and the cleanliness of the room.
negativeText: None
title: Excellent, will stay there again

positiveText: great breakfast, lovely room

The hotel is super convenient to Shinagawa Station, which is a quieter (compared to Shinjuku, Shibuya, Ikebukuro and Tokyo Stations) but still major JR Station.  We really liked the breakfast buffet at the hotel, The bed was comfy and all the staff we talked to were friendly and helpful.  We flew into Haneda, and getting from Haneda to the hotel was fast and very easy.
title: Convenient with lots of breakfast options

positiveText:
Excellent location right next to Shinagawa station.  The hotel reception is located on the 26th floor and easiest pedestrian access is via level 2 from the station external concourse (turn right at Dean & Deluca if you are coming off the train).
The hotel is very minimal, clean and pleasant and the rooms are well appointed and spacious.
The buffet breakfast was varied and very nice.
Staff are pleasant and courteous.
negativeText: Bar prices are high.
title: Excellent location

positiveText:
The hotel is located next to the Shinagawa train station and very convenient for travelling around Tokyo. The Shinkansen was also accessible which made our travel to Kyoto very easy.
The hotel is quiet and serene.  The room was spacious and the bathroom was a good size.
Staff were friendly and efficient.  The breakfast was good.
negativeText: The bar prices were quite high.

positiveText: Excellent room, very friendly staff, perfect location.
Excellent room, very friendly staff, perfect location!

The location is excellent for those wanting to sight see the main attractions East of Tokyo. Navigating the Shinagawa station was manageable and the JR-Y line runs right through it. The hotel itself is a perfect size for excellent service, not too many rooms or people are situated there and this makes breakfast accessible and easy to navigate. The staff were amazing, they were helpful and attentive.
negativeText: Room service and the cocktails at the bar are quite expensive.

positiveText: Fantastic service and a very comfortable place to stay when first arriving in Tokyo. very easy to find from Shinagawa station. The staff were also able to assist with our luggage transfer from Tokyo to Kyoto.
negativeText: Nothing
title: Warm, Welcoming and Wonderful.

positiveText:
such a convenient location. We took subway from Haneda station to the hotel when we arrived in Japan We had big suits cases, but  there was no problem walking from Shinjuku station to the hotel. Also Shinjuku station is one of the major Shinkansen stops. We had a plan to go to Universal Studio Osaka after Tokyo stay. it was very easy access to Shinjuku station Shinkansen entrance.

The breakfast was amazing! My kids are very picky eater. But they were very happy with quality  and quantity of food.
negativeText: I cannot think of anything.
title: Wonderful.

positiveText: the stuff are all very nice and friendly
negativeText: the king club room, there is barely no view, there is a building blocking all the views

positiveText: Location, hotel design and furniture, room view, nearby shops and station. There's a 7-Eleven downstairs and lots of restaurants nearby (get off in 2nd floor to check them out). The station can be accessed via Konan exit/enterance.
title: Shinagawa Station Quiet Hotel

positiveText: location
negativeText: they forgot part of the breakfast when they brought to the room
title: very good

positiveText: Staff always go out of their way to be helpful at the Strings, it has to be one of the best hotels in Tokyo and definitely the best in Shinagawa.

Lovely hotel set at the doorstep of Shinagawa, it beats my previous stays with the convenient bridge walkway linking to the hotel lift lobby. Limited rooms meant it didn't feel overly crowded but probably Covid played a part. Some may find the breakfast selection a bit limited but they actually taste so good that you wouldn't mind the lack of variety. Spacious room comes with a view of planes landing over Haneda, the only pity was the incessant fog that probably blocked the view of Mount Fuji for the whole duration of the stay. Staffing is definitely adequate which helps the excellent service level immensely. Was very grateful for an hour checkout extension which definitely leaves a wonderful final impression of the hotel.
negativeText: Probably a bit confusing to find for the 1st timer but not a big thing once you get familiar. Definitely pricey but I think it is worth every yen.
title: Hotel of Choice in Shinagawa if budget isn't an issue

positiveText: Perfect location with great connectivity. Friendly staff with clean room. Wifi was good.
negativeText: Breakfast didn't have too many choices, but enough.
title: Great hotel at a great location

positiveText: Location
negativeText: Breakfast

negativeText: Room feels abit dated, a bit dangerous to have the shower in the tub.

positiveText: Modern clean and well located.
negativeText: A little old but it didn't show.

positiveText: Good position if You use JR. Shinagawa is big very interesting station, lot of shops, food stores, very easy to get from/to all airport. Breakfast offer is very colourful, hotel itself is quiet and has interesting interior.
negativeText: Checkout was not extendable for about 2-3 hours. Could be problem traveling with kids. Nothing more negative to add.
title: You go there, if want comfort, good location and nice view.

positiveText: Cleanliness; breakfast
negativeText: Size of room could be better but it’s larger than other hotels in Tokyo; long walk from the elevator to my room

positiveText: Good location to travel from Haneda airport to Tokyo. Taking Shinkansen to anywhere in Japan.
negativeText: Clean room that they provided to us. They also upgrade our room because we had our Wedding anniversary and friendly staff from receptionist "Yamamoto Shiori" and breakfast area staff "Christopher Lemon".
title: I will give this 9/10. We never regret to book the hotel because of the room we stay was clean and friendly staff. H

positiveText: Buffet breakfast was very good. Excellent location of you use Shinkansen and cab to Haneda airport

positiveText:
Great breakfast, it was the best part of the stay. 
But tours stay here, so long line for early breakfast.
negativeText:
No concierge. There’s a desk, but there was always no one there. Or they had to call someone who never came.
So it was hard to ask what to do.
I was looking for a tour they could recommend, but no one knew.
title: Hotel is near the shinagawa station. But there was not much to do in the area. Shopping was limited.

title: The location is good. But the rate for 2 adults and one adult is not clear on booking.com although I

positiveText: Location
negativeText:
They definitely need to improve their service.
1. When we arrived nobody greeted us at the lobby, so we had to take the suitcases from the taxi ourselves. (We had 7 big suitcases with us).
2. We found out that the receptionist is on the 26th floor. We called and they said that they’re going to send someone to help with our suitcases, but we waited for 15mins and nobody came so we brought them up ourselves (again).
3. It took us forever to complete the check in process.
4. During breakfast, I ordered croissant but they forgot to deliver it even after I asked multiple times. The restaurant wasn’t even packed. It was simple but It showed how poor the service is.
5. Again, it took us forever to complete the checkout process. Our taxi had to wait for 15mins.
title: Nothing special

positiveText: Breakfast buffet was good
negativeText: Room was tiny
title: Very expensive for what you got

positiveText: After paying a large amount as the nightly rate we didn’t get breakfast included and I was really surprised.
negativeText: No lobby. Very far location from the center

positiveText: The staff were friendly and helpful.
negativeText: A lot not to like but mostly the location and the hotel is old and is in need for a renovation. But most importantly is the noisy train station which ruined the whole experience.

positiveText: Absolutely top notch in every way. Strings connects with the Shinagawa station making traveling around Japan very easy. It’s spotlessly clean, has good but expensive restaurant choices and a great breakfast buffet. The staff is exceptional in every way and couldn’t have been more professional, welcoming and kind.
negativeText: Not a thing.
title: Fabulous Place to Stay in Tokyo with a Superb Location

positiveText:
excellent location very near to station 
staff are extremely helpful and nice

positiveText:

いつも泊まっているがスタッフの対応が良い
negativeText: 無い

positiveText: 飯店位置太棒了！與品川駅直接連結，去羽田機場30分鐘，非常方便。樓下有7-11，車站內有一間貴婦超市。早餐是它的一大亮點，豐盛，用餐環境，服務都是一流。房間設施有些舊，但住起來還舒服，床好睡，淋浴間大而好用。
negativeText: 房務還可以更用心。

positiveText: Einzigartiges Eckzimmer mit einer super Aussicht über die Stadt. Tolles freundliches und zuvorkommendes Personal. Leckeres Frühstück, sauberes Zimmer. Die zentrale Lage war sehr gut, um entsprechende Tagestouren innerhalb Stadt durchzuführen.
title: Gerne Wieder. Einfach TOP!

title: 施設や設備にはとても満足しています。

positiveText: 櫃台人員都非常親切真誠，房間整潔舒適。交通位置完美。飯店lobby在26樓，電梯坐到2樓直接有空橋銜接購物中心及高級超市，還有美食街等一堆餐廳，然後就銜接品川車站。品川是超級匯集大站，去東京市中心跟近郊景點，羽田機場都很方便。

お部屋からのロケーション、インテリア、
レストランの雰囲気が、良くて、
シャンパーニュ、フルーツ、美味しかった
